spatial_accuracy.notes: Major layout mismatches between the 2D plan and the 3D model. Key spaces that define the plan’s zoning (Alfresco, Theatre, front Verandah/Portico/Entry sequence) are not represented in the correct locations. Several room placements/adjacencies appear shifted (notably the public zone vs. front entry), and the north-side bedroom/bath/laundry cluster does not read as the same configuration as the plan (E1/E2). Door and window positioning does not match the plan’s indicated openings, and overall room proportions appear distorted (E2/E4).

structural_fidelity.notes: Adjacency relationships are not faithfully preserved: the plan’s Entry should be a defined node between Garage/Study/WIR zone, but the 3D model suggests an exterior entry into/near the living zone (E2/E3). Missing or merged rooms are evident (Alfresco, Theatre, and likely one of Bed 3/Bed 4 not clearly present as separate rooms) (E1). Some added/merged spaces (extra dining/seating zone not corresponding to the plan’s labeled rooms) indicate hallucination/incorrect segmentation (E5). Wall/door integration is inconsistent in places (E6).

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture does not reliably map to the plan’s room functions: the plan’s Theatre is a distinct room but the 3D distributes lounge seating into open areas instead (E2/E1). The Alfresco outdoor setting is not shown as an outdoor furnished area (E1). Furniture scale is generally plausible, but placement indicates mis-zoned spaces (E2).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Clean isometric-style presentation with generally good lighting and readable interiors. Camera isometric angle is acceptable and composition is clear. However, repeated/templated windows/doors and some inconsistent wall/door embedding reduce architectural credibility (E6). Not truly orthographic/isometric-technical (perspective-like shading and depth cues), but visually strong.

detected_errors.description: Alfresco (outdoor room at top-right of the 2D plan) is missing or modeled as an interior space rather than a distinct external area connected to Living/Activity.
Theatre room (left-middle of 2D plan) is not clearly present as a separate enclosed room; appears merged/omitted in the 3D layout.
Bedroom count/segmentation does not clearly match the 2D plan (Bed 3 and Bed 4 as two separate rooms at the top appear not both correctly represented).

Entry/Portico/Verandah frontage sequence is not modeled in the correct position/shape; the 3D shows a prominent exterior door on the living-side wall rather than a dedicated entry node as in the plan.
Door orientation/connection logic differs from the plan (entry access and several internal door swings/locations do not correspond to the 2D door placements).
Window placement/count is inconsistent with the 2D plan, especially along the Living/Alfresco interface where the plan implies large openings; the 3D uses generic repeated windows instead.
Wet-area cluster (Bath/WC/Laundry near the upper-left in the plan) appears reconfigured; partitions and room boundaries do not align with the 2D layout.
Proportions of key zones appear altered (open Living/Kitchen/Dining stretched relative to adjacent rooms; exterior massing does not reflect the plan’s footprint steps/recesses).
Additional/ambiguous dining/sitting area segmentation appears in the 3D that does not map cleanly to labeled rooms in the 2D plan (suggesting invented interior zoning).
Inconsistent wall thickness and door embedding (some openings/frames read as visually inconsistent with surrounding walls), reducing structural realism.
